title: Convert Hello World page to Angular component
description: Migrate existing pink Hello World + dinosaur to Angular component with route guard protection

title: Create Angular login component
description: Build functional login component with form validation and authentication flow

title: Add persistent database storage
description: Replace in-memory storage with SQLite or PostgreSQL database for user data persistence

title: Update tests for Angular app and authentication
description: Create tests for login flow, protected routes, and Hello World component

title: Add E2E integration tests for complete auth flow
description: Create end-to-end tests covering: register -> login -> access protected route -> logout. Test complete password reset flow: register -> forgot password -> reset -> login with new password.

title: Set test coverage thresholds and enforcement
description: Configure karma/jest to enforce minimum coverage thresholds (e.g., 80% statements, 75% branches). Fail builds if coverage drops below threshold. Document coverage requirements.

title: Add Dockerfile and docker-compose for development
Update documentation for new architecture
description: Update README with Angular + Node.js architecture, setup instructions, and API documentation

title: Update auth tests for new login behavior
description: Login endpoint no longer auto-creates users. Update AuthService tests and LoginComponent tests to reflect this behavior change. Remove tests for auto-creation, ensure proper 401 error handling.

title: Remove auto-create user on login endpoint
description: The login endpoint was auto-creating users if they didn't exist. This is a security issue and non-standard behavior. Changed to only allow login for existing users - users must explicitly register first.

title: Add account creation/registration workflow
description: Build UI and flow for new user registration with email validation and confirmation

title: Create basic webapp: Hello World in pink with dinosaur pixel art
PRINCIPLE: All development/testing must use containers - do not install on host
description: Core architectural constraint: This project uses Docker for all development and testing. Never install tools (Chrome, npm packages, etc.) directly on the host machine. All operations should be executed via docker-compose or docker exec commands. This keeps the host clean and ensures consistency.

title: Update Docker setup for Angular + Node.js
description: Create multi-container Docker setup: Angular frontend, Node.js backend, with docker-compose orchestration

title: Add email service for password reset
description: Currently password reset tokens are only logged to console. Implement email service (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) to send reset links to users via email.

title: Build Node.js backend with authentication API
description: Create Express server with login endpoint, JWT tokens, and user authentication

title: Document dev workflow in README
Add Chrome/Chromium to frontend Docker image for testing
description: Update frontend/Dockerfile to include Chrome/Chromium so tests can run in headless mode inside the container. Add ENV variables for CHROME_BIN and CHROME_PATH.

title: Configure CI/CD pipeline for automated testing
description: Set up GitHub Actions or similar CI/CD to run tests automatically on push/PR. Include linting, build verification, and test execution.

title: Add password reset/forgotten workflow
description: Implement forgot password flow with email token verification and password reset capability

title: Set up Docker-based dev environment for webapp
Set up Angular project structure
description: Initialize Angular app, configure routing, and set up project structure for login + main page

title: Add basic test for webapp: check Hello World and dinosaur image
Run test suite and verify coverage baseline
description: Execute the complete test suite in Docker container. Verify all tests pass. Document baseline code coverage. Identify any gaps or failing tests.
